claim: Nurses from hospital Messejana, in Brazil’s Ceará, record a video celebrating the closing of COVID-19 room due to lack of patients
label: misleading

claim: A widely shared video in which the doctor Ángel Ruiz Valdepeñas, from the Hospital of Formentera, claims during a demonstration in Madrid that “there is no coronavirus pandemic” and that, therefore, “there is no point in either the mask or social distancing.”
label: FALSE

claim: In the Philippines, the Office of the Vice President (OVP) donated spoiled food to frontliners at Diliman Doctors Hospital in Quezon City.
label: FALSE

claim: A viral image of a doctor who died from treating patients with coronavirus at the Llano de Corrientes Hospital, Argentina.
label: FALSE

claim: A video claims to have been recorded at the Hospital La Margarita, in Puebla. Images of patients in the hallway allegedly with COVID-19 and a hospital floor full of bags containing dead bodies.
label: FALSE

claim: A picture which would show a mother and her premature baby in a hospital, both infected with Covid-19.
label: FALSE

claim: A photo of Joice Hasselmann, Brazilian federal deputy (representative) who recently was diagnosed with COVID-19, walking on a hospital corridor without a mask. The caption states she is faking the disease.
label: FALSE

claim: A video of a COVID-19 patient in a Brazillian hospital claims they are deliberately letting more patients dies and recording deaths as COVID-19.
label: Misleading

claim: Joice Hasselmann, brazilian federal deputy, appears without a mask in a photo in the hospital even after a positive diagnosis of COVID-19
label: FALSE

claim: Doctors of a hospital in New Zealand are cheering in this video after they cure the last COVID-19 patient of their country and shut the COVID-19 ward.
label: FALSE

claim: A picture of the Egyptian doctor, Mohamed Hashad, carrying an oxygen cylinder in an attempt to save the lives of Covid-19 patients in an isolation hospital in Egypt. He died after contracting coronavirus.
label: Misleading

claim: Brazilian MPs revealed the hospital claiming it treats 5,000 COVID-19 patients.
label: FALSE

claim: A widely shared video claims to show Brazilian lawmaker Filippe Poubel erupt in anger as he breaks into a field hospital that had claimed to have 5,000 novel coronavirus patients and finds it empty.
label: FALSE

claim: Video with the claim that members of Brazilian Parliament broke into a hospital and found it had no coronavirus patients.
label: FALSE

claim: Brazilian Supreme Court denied order for army hospitals to treat COVID-19 patients.
label: FALSE
